This revised model of the Switch comes with a number of features that I honestly can't fully appreciate as someone who didn't own the previous model. The big thing that drew me in was the extended battery life, even though so far I haven't played much in handheld mode and not at all in tabletop, but they use the same amount of battery either way I would imagine. The reason I'm giving this system five stars probably say more about how good it is than anything else. But I pretty much expected as much. I'm sure by now you can go online and find more detailed reviews for the gaming system, but in case you're wondering here, this one comes with the system, two gray joycons, two attachments to turn each joycon into its own controller, a base to connect both joycons into the formation of a singular controller, the required cables, and the Switch dock. So you'll probably want to buy a few things alongside this such as an SD card for reasonable storage space, a pro controller for a more standard controller experience, maybe a dock sleeve to prevent the possibility of scratching the screen from insertion and ejection of the system, an online pass if you plan to play any games with online features... just basically a lot of things that would be nice if they came with the system itself. This will inflate the price further, but the thing here is that this is going to replace the old models of the Switch and simply make this the main one manufactured now. So... basically, if you want a cheaper Switch you'll want to get a Switch Lite and this one will still cost about 300 bucks like the 2.5+ year-old original variant still costs. That is, unless you want to go used. I'm only bringing up these points because while this is a great system, I do think you should be aware of what is likely to happen with prices and availability going forward and plan accordingly. Once I realize a Switch was still going to cost the same if I wanted the ability to do on and off TV play I decided I might as well just hop on board with this newer variant. I'd recommend you do the same as it has had tweaks to make it just a slightly better version all around than the previous model. Otherwise, if price is a concern, wait for the Switch Lite and see how it tickles your fancy. Also, here's tip. If you want to turn the system off as opposed to leaving it in sleep mode, simply hold down the power button on the system for a few seconds and then a menu will appear with the option to restart or shut down. Also note that you cannot play on the TV off of the Switch's battery power. The dock needs to be plugged in for the dock to function. I hope something in here was helpful.

So, I did some research and bought this switch because it is advertised as the 'NEW' model with serial number beginning with 'XKW'. It is said to have better battery life, possibly a boosted processor, and generally just be an updated switch model. That being said, the old discontinued model still retails for the same amount. I checked my model on my 'NEW AND IMPROVED' switch, and it is the sane as my 2018 switch XAW. Needless to say, I am rather disappointed in Amazon. I installed all my games, transferred data, and now I am stuck with wiping and returning it or just settling for a mediocre version of the switch. Thanks for the annoyance Amazon! Also, the left Joy-con bumper was broken right out of the box! It was also covered in grease. $300 for outdated switch, and a broken controller. I don't normally leave nasty reviews, but I'm pretty bummed. Also nintendo will switch out the outdated one, but I have to ship it to them!

Product description: " Also includes all the extras you need to get started. "  Not!  There is not a single game that comes with this.  You buy a PC, it comes with some rudimentary games.  You buy a Mac, it comes with some games.  You buy a Playstation, it has a few built-in games.  My son opened this for Christmas, was so excited, only to find out that it has no games, not even a cheap little token game, to actually "get started".  A quick peak at game prices, and you'll soon realized that you've been duped by Nintendo.  Their games are ridiculously expensive.  Due to son's excitement, I'm reluctantly going to follow through and drop more bucks, but I'm doing so with buyer's remorse.

I wish I could give negative stars for Nintendo. This was purchased as a gift for the kids for Christmas after recommendations from some friends. I still don’t get any appeal to Nintendo? We have only had it open for 2 days and already both JoyCons are complete toast. The drift in both is so bad that you can’t make right turns playing Mario Kart. I checked the calibration and followed a number of online tutorials for things to try, but to no avail. Come to find out, there is a class action lawsuit against Nintendo for this very problem. Apparently the solution is to send the controllers to Nintendo and wait a month for them to diagnose and maybe repair them. This is probably why I haven’t thought about the brand Nintendo for almost 20 years since I last owned any of their products. I’ve owned virtually every gaming console created and never once had this issue with any other controllers. If you are so desperate to play outdated video games with Nintendo level quality that enduring this garbage is worth it to you, then more power to you. I’m fine dumping this console in the trash and going back to forgetting Nintendo even exists for the next 20 years. I’ll stick to Xbox.

In terms of raw horsepower (CPU, graphics, whatever) the Nintendo Switch is far behind the current generation of consoles like the XBox One.  But, the Switch is a unique device.  As a handheld, it is quite powerful (the latest iteration nearly doubles the handheld's battery life, addressing the Switch's greatest weakness).  This allows you to play the same game on your TV and keep playing it as you take it out with you --- a unique ability.Most importantly, there is a staggering array of software available for it.  Software is what makes or breaks a console, no matter how good it is.

Definitely love how bright the colors are on this switch, more of a neon pastel shade. The switch is the V2, which has extended battery life and a more efficient CPU. Comparing this switch the the V1, the IPS panel has a warmer tint whereas the V1 is much brighter. Though color values do vary across switches. The joycons themselves are more of a matte finish on the coating rather than the glossy feel on previous joycons. The colors match well with the dock and will definitely stand out by your TV. The dock itself is a bit wider compared to the V1 allowing more wiggle room to prevent the switch from being scratched, though I do recommend purchasing a glass screen protector. The pattern on the back of the switch definitely gives it an "animal crossing" feel to showcasing. They did a really good job in making the pattern stand out compared to previous special edition switches.Overall, pretty happy with having a new switch that stands out and has a longer battery life. Will definitely be a well-used switch in the coming months.

I don’t use this the way that Nintendo advertises; predominantly hand held.  I have the Skull & Company Grip Case attached at all times and only play in handheld mode.  The Switch Lite is too small and doesn’t have the HD rumble like this one has.  This model is the better one with the longest battery life currently available.  This is not designed with comfort in mind for handheld play sessions so the Lite may be a better option if comfort is important.  If you get hand cramps like I do, I highly recommend the Skull & Company grip case.  They also have a great travel case that you can get with it that has plenty of space for the switch with case and joycons attached and space for games, a power adapter and power bank.  It is very good quality and the Switch is dockable with the grip case attached.The switch itself has a much faster, more user friendly, prettier, less congested graphics user interface than all of Nintendo’s previous consoles.  It has a solid state drive for saving and downloading some games, and is expandable with the purchase of Micro SD cards for additional space.  The online store is easy to use and probably the best Nintendo has ever had.  Easy to sort by price, genre, developer.  It is fast and easy to use and you can sort for free games and demos too.  The load time between starting games and between cut scenes in game is very quick on hard drive, sd card, and game cartridge.  Much quicker than nintendo’s previous consoles.  I haven’t played with the joy cons detached so I can’t comment on how responsive the joycons are to movement and player interaction when joycons are detached.  The HD rumble is more subtle than on PS4 and XBox but some games have used it very well.  Mario Odyssey for example has done a great job of blending the environments in some levels to match well with the rumble feedback; its hard to explain, but this feels like the next step in controller evolution and PS5 and NextBox will be adopting a similar tech so more developers should get on board with HD Rumble in future games, hopefully.  The switch buttons have a nice click and feel like they will last, much like most of Nintendo’s products but the stick feels a little looser than the PS4.  I would like Nintendo to tighten that up for the Pro version.  Overall, this is decades of Nintendo engineering in the making which has resulted in, arguably their best console to date.  It is going to shatter console sales records for good reason.  I highly recommend this version of the Switch for the battery life, larger screen and hd rumble, but you may want to get a comfort grip if you will be using it predominantly as a handheld.  I no longer play on my 3DS because this is a much better player experience.
Definitely worth the extra hundred compared to the smaller switch lite.joycons fit and feel more ergonomic in palm and extra inch in screen is nice.

I love my Switch, this console really brings me back to my childhood, there is something about it that recaptured that magic I felt playing my Super Nintendo and even the GameCube. I've played every Nintendo console and while I was a major fan of the early ones, after the Cube, I got sucked into the Xbox 360 and then the PS4, but, this console is the first I've played in years that brings me back to that childhood magic. I got this console on a whim after watching Detective Pikachu and realizing how much I missed Pokémon games, so I had to get Let's Go Pikachu and pre-order Pokémon Shield, as well as getting back into Mario, and checking out Fire Emblem Warriors which is totally amazing. All in all, not only are the exclusive games amazing, but, the console and even the joycon controller rig are something special. I can't put my finger on it, and I really can't put it into words, but this is a great system and for kids or those trying to rediscover the child inside of them, this is a must have. Just don't try to get inside a child with this is, or you're going to jail sicko.

This review is for the Nintendo Switch w/Grey joycons, V2 HAC-001(-01). I've owned the original Switch(HAC 001) and recently, the Switch Lite(Turquoise). Battery life wasn't so good with the original Switch and only a bit better with the Lite. This Switch model has improved battery life, up to 40% depending on brightness settings, volume settings, and the type of game you're playing. Another thing I've noticed is if you download digital games, it takes less time. The graphics(colors) seem to be more vibrant.If you're a gamer who likes to play games on the T.V exclusively, this would be the perfect choice. On the other hand,

I couldn't believe my luck when I was able to snag one at MSRP after the release date. It's so cute! I like the design of this one much better than the other switches, and the dock is adorable, especially if you're an Animal Crossing fan. And it's the newer version with improved battery life, too! I was thinking about getting a switch for a while, but the lack of games I absolutely had to have and the colors (I'm not a big fan of the standard colors/designs) put me off. Animal Crossing solved both of these problems with ACNH and this amazing special edition.My only complaint (other than how difficult it was to get - finally caught a restock in the middle of the night and even that sold out in less than 5 minutes) is that sometimes one of the joycons gets stuck when trying to remove it from the strap. It's probably just an issue with mine in particular, but it does make it kind of annoying to remove. I have to put some force into it, and I'm sure that one of these days, I'll accidentally scratch myself trying to remove it. Otherwise, it's very cute, and at MSRP, I'd definitely choose it over the other colors!

Spent several days during the COVID-19 pandemic searching high and low for a Switch anywhere.  Most of what was available were 3rd party sellers charging $100 to even $200 over market value which is asinine.  Missed a couple stocks at Best Buys that sold out in seconds.Finally I just put on Netflix and had Amazon open and kept refreshing.  Missed a couple then finally had some used listings straight from Amazon for get this, $280!

Alright so since the Covid-19 outbreak has officially ruined my sisters senior year she had started getting into animal crossing. After playing on the I Phone app for what felt like forever she decided she wanted to transition to a game on the 3ds console. Since she had started playing animal crossing new leaf she fell in love with the series. So as her big sister I had decided I would get her this limited edition themed switch in hopes of helping with her depression as well as to cheer her up for her senior year being ruined. Also so she could get a taste of Animal Crossing new horizons for when it comes out March 20th, 2020!  The day I told her I purchased it she hopped with joy. I was excited too considering I was sharing my own excitement for animal crossing with my sister. It had finally arrived. Its box didn't come in damaged and the console was packed safely to prevent possible damages. It works perfectly as any nintendo switch should with no defects at all in the console itself. The only concerns I have to remind future buyers is that the joycons will stop working properly after a year of use. This is coming from my own nintendo switch experiences and other fellow switch owners where the controls will drift randomly while you're trying to play a game after a year after consistant use. So I'd be best to invest in a second set of controllers just in case.All I have left to say is that this was indeed worth my money and my sister couldn't be happier with her early senior graduation gift!

After a little over a month of (very light) use, the hdmi connection no longer works. The switch will still charge while in the dock, but I cannot play on the TV while in docked mode. I can confirm it is an issue with the refurbished switch as I have another switch that I use personally, that works with both docks, my original switch dock and the dock provided with the refurbished one.
Beware that this a USED OVERPRICE Switch, NOT NEW.  Double the MSRP of $299 new.

I want to start by getting the obvious out of the way. Scalpers = Trash, and I cannot believe with everything going on right now that Amazon is allowing them to sell at such inflated prices.  Wait for the official Amazon restocks because they charge MSRP, now onto the Switch.Love it. I cannot say that enough.  The console won't blow you away, but it will keep you entertained for hours. Whether you play in docked mode or handheld mode, they both work very well and looks very good on both screens.  The battery on this generation is much improved over the day 1 release.  The battery itself is the same size, but Nintendo put in a more efficient processor which extends the battery life.

My screen was blank the first time i turned it on though I could still hear the sound of the menu.  It took a call to Nintendo to figure out how to fix it.  Not really what you expect from a $350 dollar product.  I did a hard reboot and put it in maintenance mode to fix it which only worked for a few weeks.  Now the screen is completely dead.  This really doesn't look good for Nintendo's quality control seeing that the Switch failed to perform out of the box.  Furthermore, I have had read numerous other stories online of people experiencing the same thing.  Nintendo needs to get better hardware and quality control processes.  The last Nintendo system I owned was an N64 which was a brick house and never had any problems.  The Switch just feels cheap.

This is my first switch console. So let me start off by saying the console itself is absolutely beautiful. The design on the back is so pretty and the joycons are gorgeous as well.My biggest issue is not the console itself. But the accessories for it. I’m sure you’ve seen the terrible reviews for the joycons themselves. If you haven’t please check them out. I had done my research on them before hand and ended up buying a different controller just because I was so nervous about using the joycons. The idea is awesome. But they feel so flimsy and cheap. I hadn’t planned to even use the ones that came with the console. I planned to put them away as collectors items. But of course I had to use them to start up the console. As I was holding them I felt the plastic on the back of the right joycon move and make a loud snap. I thought I broke it and I hadn’t even done anything. I was just setting up the console. The colors may look great. But after having that as my first experience I do believe all the reviews I’ve seen for them.
These prices are super redick. No one should give any of these third party people money. That's just unfair

I bought the Switch a few months ago and now that I’ve spent some time with it (more than I’d like to admit ^_^) I wanted to leave a review.The Switch has many pros over other consoles, it’s main pro being that it’s a portable console with games that previously are only found on PC or console. I am a PC gamer and my PC is an absolute beast with an 8700K & 2080 Ti BUT the reason I bought a Switch is because oftentimes I am out and about and can’t bring my big honkin’ PC with me. Obviously I prefer my PC but it’s nice to be able to play games like Witcher 3 and then  when I have to go somewhere in the car or something I can seamlessly “Switch” to the Switch and continue my game.

Please don't think bundle means animal crossing game is with it because its not!!!!I feel mislead.. now I see where it says game not included but like many when it says Animal Crossing Bundle u just assume because of the price u get the game to!
But soon I noticed that the dock can't recognize my switch.....So I asked replacement to Amazon customer center and they said only return is available.

I managed to snatch a retail price Switch away from scalpers somehow.  Which took about two months of attempts to pull off!  Anyways here is my honest assessment after watching repair videos.The Switch is an excellent console at an excellent value (As long as you can obtain one at MSRP).  However being what it is the Switch itself is fairly fragile.  If your child has the self control of Angry German Kid(tm) this would not be the best gift for them.  And if playing it in undocked mode understand by all that is holy that the Nintendo Switch is not a modern smartphone.  There is no water resistance built into the design.  Submerging the switch or even spilling something onto it will likely be the end of the console.  The docking port is another point of fragility.  It won't suffer being slammed into the dock well.  All of the weight of the unit is baring down on that port while docking so being gentle and sorta gingerly easing it down is advised.  The Joycons are also rather fragile.  Not flimsy but they won't tolerate mauling like let's say a PS1 controller could take.

I received the newer model, as advertised and it has been great.  No complaints on the system - it's exactly what I was looking for.  Make sure to pay attention to which models go on sale this Black Friday.  The newer one (red box) has a new graphics chip which allows better battery life and a slightly different screen.

Seller deliberately did not state that the console was for sale and use in either Korea/Phillipines/Dubia as it turned out after calling Nintendo and giving them the ups code the one I received was meant for the Phillipines. I called the seller Wacky Jacky and told them what was written on the bottom of the box, he then told me to please wait a minute while he got another from his warehouse and proceeded to verify what I said then said he was sorry and that he had no idea and that his distributor assured him it was a US (North America) console. He then said I feel really bad and was going to send me a $100 gift card but what he did was refund $100 of the purchase price thinking that I would then keep the system. I don't know why he thought I would keep the system when I already had my return authorization label printed out and told him I was returning it, never did I say I wanted to keep the system. Am I supposed to believe he didn't know it wasn't a North America console when even now he has edited his listing to let any future buyers know that what he's selling isn't intended to be sold in the US. The seller asked me to please edit my review and rating but I see no reason to change the stars although I did edit this review to include the conversation with him and the fact that he did not add a note to his product description to make buyers aware of the consoles region. BEWARE WHEN YOU ARE BUYING A SYSTEM THAT IT MAY NOT BE INTENDED FOR SALE IN THE US..... CONTACT THE SELLER BEFORE BUYING AND HAVE THEM VERIFY WHAT IS WRITTEN ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX
After three days of use I started experiencing drift. Not only that it was used and damaged. $500 for a broken switch is not worth it.
Almost everything about this console is perfect but the joy cons are flawed and Nintendo continues to ship the defective line as standard issue in switch and switch lite

I was suppose to receive my package October 27th. I didn't receive my package until the 29th. It wasn't Amazon fought at all. I blame USPS for screwing up. They sent my package to the wrong address. So I had to go online and have them redeliver my package.When I finally receive my package I notice it wasn't damaged or tampered with. The switch box was still intact thank God. One thing I notice is the switch itself looks more premium if that makes any type of sense. Lol You can tell they fixed a lot issues with the joycons and other things. My OG switch had so many flaws. My TV screen would go black then turn back on for some reason while playing. The vents on my switch ended up melting off. The back had so many scratches from the dock.

TLDR: Product is SO CUTE!! BUT doesn’t do anything special compared to a regular Switch (other than give 10/10 on aesthetic) so don’t buy unless you can afford it/the look it worth it to you.Long review:

The new battery life is amazing. I bought this for my significant other for our anniversary to play the new Pokemon games on with me. During some preliminary tests right before the games release, hers outlasts my original unit by hours. So this is a much improved unit and I am debating just buying me one and gifting my old unit to a family friend or something.Plus new joy-cons always feel nice in your hands. And the colors are amazing.

La caja de amazon estaba entre abierta, no estaba totalmente cerrada. El producto venia en una caja sin ningun sellos de seguridad (es un open box) . Yo pague por un producto nuevo. La caja no estaba en optimas condiciones. Tampoco tenia ningun tipo de proteccion.

For quite some time Nintendo has been underwhelming when it comes to hardware specs on consoles. To the point that I switched to buying only the handhelds after the Gamecube. With the jump to an Nvidia GPU, not only does the bar for graphics get bumped up significantly from what Nintendo has released recently, it also allows third-party title developers the ability to bring their fun games to Nintendo for releases.Let's state that this isn't as powerful as the PS4 or Xbox One, but still has very good graphics. Not only that, but being able to undock it and play it like a handheld is an awesome feature. Switch Online, a service needed for online gaming, also includes NES and SNES titles you can play for free (included in the price really). My ONE issue, is that chat is needed through an external app. If this is done so the playing experience online requires less bandwidth in the rooms and therefore is smoother on the servers, than it makes sense. Otherwise, seems a bit annoying to have to need another device for it.

The price was already heavily inflated. I was more than willing to pay. But how are you going to make me pay 700$ and not include everything? I was excited only to see the straps were missing. If i paid 700, i would want everything included.

Just like so many others, the left Joy Con died. Took about a week. Get a PlayStation or Xbox unless you like spending $300 on something that doesnt work and the company thats selling it KNOWS its selling you garbage
just cuz im depressed and desperate to play nintendo games doesnt mean im stupid enough to pay more than retail price :)

This special edition of Nintendo Switch has been sold out everywhere. You would never know how happy I was when I see it available on Amazon! Initially, I thought it's a system mistake to let me place my order successfully until the time I saw the Switch shipped to my door only a couple of days later! Thank you, Amazon! This version of the Nintendo Switch is super cute so that I bought it even I have one before. I like it so much! Thank you, Amazon!
Nice product, however I purchased on black Friday with code for a free $25 gift card. I have received no such card, and now I don't see any notion that I purchased with the code.

Scam alert!  Be very careful. I just received this from Amazon, not a reseller, and everything was fine until I booted up the system and it was all in Chinese.  Apparently the Chinese version is language locked and can’t play most games.  Seems like the Chinese console got placed into a US box.  Returning now.
The Nintendo Switch has been extremely hyped up for me, so I finally gave in and bought one to play Animal Crossing and Ring Fit Adventure.PROS:

I have an loaded opinion on this console that I want to express. The Switch is flawed. As an avid gamer who usually ends up buying all the consoles (except the xbox one) and loves the hardware behind these machines, the switch was super cool when I first heard about it and saw it. I got one not to long after release once they came back to my area. Though it took awhile to save up for any games as during that point in its life, everything was expensive on it and 3rd party devs hadn't moved to it yet. Also there were no media apps on it besides hulu which somehow is still a thing, surprising. But that isn't what I want to talk about, its more how the switch feels really damn cheap.I don't mean cheap as with the plastic shell either (but that is an issue, dislike the texture a lot, and it was also damaged by strong adhesives from dbrand before), but you get a wimpy TN panel for its main built in display, in an era where amoled and ips are very obtainable for device of this size (the original psvita was oled, so it could have been possible). As the resolution is at a solid 720p, which can help balance good enough quality on the go with actual game performance, I feel like they should have opted for a nicer quality screen to have better range of colors, would have created more vivid scenes using sharper and brighter colors. Instead they chose washed out TN panels which leave a lot to be desired when comparing it to any handheld screen semi modern hand held screen with exception of DS's which also chose awful screens. (and some might argue TN for faster response time, and to that, I highly disagree with improvements to other display types, and also for the type of audience the switch aims at)

As badly as I would love this switch the fact that people are allowed to buy them in bulk and resell them at such a higher value. Is ridiculous. I'll either wait for a restock or get a skin for my switch. Not giving these scums a penny. 🖐 Which is what everyone should do, then everyone that bought bulk will have wasted $ on product they aren't selling. Because I will never pay more than the products worth.

I got this Gray version of the Nintendo Switch after a few months of hunting for retail price $299. There's a couple of websites out there that will notify you of in-stock. I happened to be able to grab it off of Amazon, but GameStop, Target, Walmart, Best Buy, etc, also have them as well. With it being in stock is rare, so you just have to look and be patient! Plan a few months ahead for birthday / xmas gifts so you have time to wait for a retail priced stock is in. Enough about the INSANE price gouging....I am very pleased with the Switch and am very happy with it. I have played on it for a week so far and everything is working fine and dandy, as it should. One gripe is that the storage capacity is small so only a few games can be played at a time, but with a micro SD card, possibilities are endless. I ordered one of those, and expect it soon so I can expand my downloaded game collection. I've enjoyed the Switch so much I'm getting some additional joycons and a grip and a charging station. I'm going to continue looking for accessories. Maybe a case I also had to get a TV adapter because my old TV only has one HDMI port, so I had to RCA to HDMI it up in order to not unplug and replug my Roku every time I want a bigger screen. How that goes is yet to be determined.

We’re very lucky to get our hands on one. The system looks beautiful and it came in perfect condition. If you’re looking for a restock check out ACpocketnews on Twitter. They’re a great page that always posts updates when different stores restock. Please do not support these greedy people trying to mass purchase and resell this. Just be patient and I’m sure you’ll be able to get your hands on one :)

Defected. Control keeps scrolling right. Seems like this is a common problem after some research. Was excited to come home and play PokeMon Shield. This ruined my night. Will be returning all items that I bought due to frustration.Update: instead of returning I went on YouTube and found a fix for my controls. After getting that fixed, I'll have to say this is by far the best system I've ever purchased.

We got lucky and only paid $299.99 for this Switch. If I were you, I would hold out until you can find one for MSRP. Don't pay these ridiculous inflated prices.It came new in the box, never used, and came with everything needed. Power adapter, dock, HDMI cable, joy-con grips, and the wrist straps. Switch had half a charge upon arrival, and set up just fine.

The red box tells you that this is the new model with twice the battery life. I never owned the previous model but I can tell you that I played in handheld mode mostly from 11:30 am to 4:30 pm with the exception of lunch, and I played 'til about 4 pm before I got the low battery warning. I watched a Youtube video that also showed that the colors on the screen are more accurate and the cooling system has been improved. So if you're wanting to play Witcher 3 on here, I recommend getting this one, as that power hungry game might warp the chassis from overheating. On top of that they are the same price right now, so I don't think anyone should get the old model until the price goes down.

I have only tried the game in hand held and tablet mode, I am also using a samsung galaxy charger because it is less bulky. So I cant comment on the dock and charger, though I wish they are working fine 😅The game console is the v2 with the longer battery lifetime, it is amazing and very entertaining. I have played zelda and mario party and the graphics are amazing and very enjoyable

Ok, here's a review from a mama that has no game. I know nothing about the console itself. Here are the things I do know. My son won Christmas. Opening this baby was a jumping, dancing celebration. He was very, very happy. The hubby had it up and going easily and quickly, and it went from box to play time in about 30 minutes. Be prepared to spend about $20 at start up to join Nintendo, and you get a couple packs of games, some looked retro to me. The battery life is amazing, seriously. We had a 4 hour road trip getting home after Christmas, and it held the charge the entire trip. Wow! I feel like it was a good purchase.

Spent a lot of time looking to find a switch that wasn’t overpriced, and after doing lots of refreshing and looking at stock informer sites, I was finally able to purchase one. Is in perfect condition, brand new, and delivered on time! Definitely worth the wait of getting it at standard pricing, now to spend countless hours playing ACNH!

Wonderful product. There are many minor hiccups that I already knew of before purchasing this product e.g. joycon drift, shakey joycons, hot while docked, online connectivity, dock scratch, etc. However, most of these risks i knew well ahead of time and so I was not bothered by them as most already have a diy fix for them as discovered by the Switch community. Great product, do some research before purchasing one, Nintendo methodology in developing their products can be a little strange at times but the good outweighs the bad with this product.
THE PRODUCT I RECEIVED WAS PREVIOUSLY USED!!! IT HAS PARENTAL PASSWORD, ONE CONTROL DAMAGED AND SINCE I GAVE IT AS A BIRTHDAY PRESENT A MONTH AFTER RECEIVED IT, NOW I CAN'T RETURN IT.
Had to spend 69 dollars on joy cons because the ones that came wouldnt charge. Defective

I ordered using a black friday promo code to receive an amazon gift card with unit. The unit came as advertised in two days but there is not trace of a gift card anywhere. Nintendo's costumer service chat is useless, there is a robot who is supposed to direct your concern to the appropriate department but no one answers.

On paper this is such a slick device, and combined with great Nintendo titles this was something I was excited for. BUT this system just isn't there yet. Right now I'm dealing with input lag that goes beyond controller or title specific issues. Right from the get go, setting it up (while in portable mode) felt odd. The touch screen and the attached joy-cons felt a bit slow. The input lag was the same speed as my PS4 with my TVs game mode OFF. Not a huge deal for many who will play most casual games, but annoying enough for me that titles like Cuphead and Enter the Gungeon are hindered. I do wonder if the newer portable only version doesn't have these issues, but I'm mainly interested in this as a home console.And it's online component? They still haven't caught up with Xbox Live from the 360 generation. Not a huge problem with Discord around, but still.

The switch is already of my favorite consoles I’ve ever owned. As an adult-I’ve been surprised by how much I play it in handheld mode. It’s nice to be able to sneak in some gaming time here and there at work when there is some downtime. And I actually find myself playing it in handheld mode pretty often at home when I’m watching football on the weekends. I’m glad I waited until this model with the improved battery life came out. Sometimes, I don’t have to put it on the dock to charge for 5 or 6 days, assuming I’m playing 30 minutes here and there. I highly recommend this system.

Okay so this is going to be a review with my overall experience. Yes, it was overpriced, I think this was worth it, I personally got it for the Joy-cons, and I don't regret it, because you really don't know when you will get the opportunity to get one for less. Anyways, arrived in perfect condition, first switch ever, the only thing that was wrong is the Left Bumper on the Joy-con, which i don't know how to explain it but kind of loose, more than the Right Bumper. It bothers me because of something on the inside, and also since I paid a lot for this switch but not enough to complain, its just something i'll have to live with. But besides that, it was a great experience, the bumper was the only thing that gave me a fright since it feels very weird. Now I don't have anything to play since my game doesn't arrive until Wednesday, but just downloading free games is fun, but originally there is only 25gb so I would recommend getting a micro SD, but i think that's all.

This is, strangely enough, the first portable system I have ever bought in my 30+ years of gaming. I’ve actually bought 2 Switches so far. The first one was a Christmas present for my son who I was trying to ease into video games. He loves it. After him having it for a year and me occasionally playing it to help him through areas where my greater experience with games could help get through certain areas, I was tempted to get one for myself to play when I had long periods of downtime at work. When Witcher 3 came out for the switch, I bought another one for me and have been playing it a few times per week since.My experience with the console is pretty much strictly in the handheld mode. I bought a Satisfye grip and case for my switch which allows me to hold the system more comfortably than I would without it. Holding the standard system and playing for more that 20 minutes or so causes my hands to cramp. The small joycons are just too small for adult male hands to use for long without some discomfort. I’m fine with that since the small size makes the system easier for kids, like my son, to use. A regular controller can be a bit bulky for a grade school age kid to use well. With the case and grip, this system is perfect for me to throw into my vehicle at work and forget about it until things slow down when I’m waiting for a call. Then I can break it out and pass the time in style.

The game system we received is the newer one with better battery life. However, we've been disappointed with the joys cons. Both right joy cons in the included one and another set we bought would disconnect. If you read online there are all kinds of issues with the joy cons ever since they made the system. There are fewer problems since they updated them, however, the joy cons we received with this system are dated 2017, before they updated them. So, new game system, old joy cons. Seriously disappointed in this. Nintendo is in the process of setting up a warranty repair, but I shouldn't have to do this for a brand new system. The individual set we bought is going back and we purchased new ones in a local store that should theoretically be newer. To initiate the repair Nintendo asked about a hundred questions and 2 hours later the repair is accepted. Not a good setup, in my opinion.
Almost twice the amount of the MSRP. You're a fraud and should be put in prison for taking innocent people's money. Like wtf dude c'mon.

I bought this system for myself as a birthday present, and I have enjoyed using it!  The controllers took a bit getting used to detaching on and off properly.  I think the main thing is to be careful about what games you buy if the device will be worth it to you in the end, or if you are excited about upcoming games.  I waited to purchase the Switch until I knew there were about ten games I wanted to play and added about three of them into the in initial cost as well.  I’m pretty picky about my games because I am a casual gamer. Zelda breath of the wild—which I borrowed from my brother later— is more intensive than anything I have played in YEARS.Games are expensive in physical format, although that is my preference.  There are some cheaper games on the online store.  So far my favorite local game shop does not have any used copies of Switch games although they have everything else.  Maybe some day.

Similar to other Nintendo systems, innovation is always attached to their new ideas. The joy cons are similar to the wii remotes, albeit not as precise for some games where they were used for shooting type games, the joy cons are incredible for multiplayer. I honestly prefer using one joycon whenever I can when playing games, it's really nifty being able to play two player automatically with a friend or family member without having to pay for an expensive controller, or a cheaper built one.Nintendo Apps are so-so at the moment, it would be great to have streaming apps such as Netflix for streaming, but other apps such as Youtube have worked well streaming but I do not like the interface for searching for videos.
This is the most beautiful Nintendo Switch Console I ever have, and probably ever will, seen. It's so smooth and relaxing to just look at. Worth the money as long as it's not bought from a scalper!

I finally caved and got one (of course at retail price. It’s great so far, I love it. The box came on time and in good condition. Very easy set-up!I’ve never had a console before, so this is my first official one!! I was considering between this and the lite, but I think it’s totally worth it getting this one. I like to have the option to play it on my TV. I also didn’t think the switch screen would be that big but it’s actually a decent size.

Glad to get one at retail price! This is by far the most fun system on the market today. If you see one for sale at $299.99 or less BUY IT! Just keep checking! That’s what I did. Try sites like zoolert (google it) to let you know when they’re in stock! I have faith in you!

I received a Switch that is unable to connect to the TV, so, it's pretty much just a more expensive Switch Lite.  After an insane amount of troubleshooting, I was finally told by Nintendo that the product was defective.  Nintendo wanted me to ship it in for repairs, THE DAY AFTER I BOUGHT IT.  So instead of offering me an exchange, they want me to send in my BRAND NEW SWITCH for repairs.  Kind of ridiculous if you ask me, they should have replaced my Switch no questions asked.  On top of that, Amazon is not offering exchanges either. I am very disappointed that neither company has a reasonable solution for defective Switches. I will be returning this Switch, and I can tell you, it definitely wasn't worth the headache trying to get my hands on it.

This review is targeted at newcomers so for veterans of Nintendo products, not much new information here! As for everyone else looking at this gaming system wondering if its right for them, I'll do my best to explain what this model in particular brings to the table. In my particular case a: "Nintendo Switch with Gray Joy‑Con - HAC-001(-01)"Introduction to the system/What is a Nintendo Switch?:

Our household doesn’t buy the latest, greatest gaming systems but it was time to upgrade our original Wii for another family friendly system. The reviews were pretty glowing for the Switch and I can say they’re warranted. Just make sure you buy the newer generation (this product) so you have better battery life and less decline over the life of the product.I love how Nintendo the Parental Controls essentially live within an app on the parent’s phone. A motivated kid can hack just about anything so keeping these settings non-local is a brilliant little safeguard. My kids have to ask me for “more time” when they’ve hit a daily limit (which is customizable for the day of the week). It’s very much like a simpler, more reliable version of Apple’s Screen Time feature on iPhones. Of course, you can also unlock more time on the switch itself using a pin code.

I can play and explore in games for 7+ hours before needing to connect to the charger. The transition from handheld to tv display is almost seamless (just a slight lag before the display pops up on the tv). I love being able to stay and play at home or take it on the go with me.

Use apps like HotStock and Twitter bots like @_kinnybot to notify you instantly of switch restocks at retail $299. It may take a few days so be patient! It took me about a week or two at most. I missed a Walmart and a Best Buy one but I got lucky on Amazon thanks to kinnybot. So it is possible to get it without price gouges.
It stopped working after 3 weeks. Wouldnt come on and I returned it and now my child cannot find one for over 300 more then I paid

This is the version you want HAC-001(-01). Runs cooler and battery life is way better.  I would also say the color on the screen is warmer than my older version.The Switch has been my favorite Nintendo console since the SNES. Tons of great games on the system and a lot of classics.  Having access to games on the go is fantastic.  I play my Switch docked a lot as well and looks good even on my 4k TV. It doesn't have the graphic level of a PS4 Pro or Xbox One X but I find I play this more than either of those consoles.  Also from a family standpoint, the kids love playing together in Smash Bros and Mario Kart. We have a lot of fun all around with it.

I'm mainly going to list off the pros for this unit, something I like that they did on this generation compared to the other consoles by Nintendo and some gripes.Portability obviously with its docking capabilities - very good move.  The way the Switch locates itself within the dock is a cool party trick.  I like not having to have a rucksack full of gear just to bring my system with.

The only way Nintendo will hear is is through reviews. Limit purchases 1-2 per household. These people buying up special editions and reselling for double the price HAS to stop. DO NOT BUY FROM THEM. Let them sit on the consoles for as long as they possibly can. Nintendo make thousands more please - I beg you. Makes the people lose on their “investment” for once.

I knew people who owned the Switch were seemingly all very happy with it, and I planned on getting one at some point. When Pokemon moved to the Switch, "some point" became "right now".Nintendo likes to make their consoles unique. The DS Lite had two screens, a touch screen, and a microphone that were all used to make the experience unique. The 3DS, The Wii, and Wii U also had their own interesting elements. At times, it just felt gimmicky. The Switch on the other hand, doesn't feel that way at all.
Very beautiful and cute edition. Fast delivery. And feel lucky to get one during the 30 minutes' window on release date.

It’s great! Bought this to play Pokémon since I waited 3 years for them to release games I had been waiting on. Sold my original switch, this one is the new model with the longer battery life! And it’s definitely noticeable. I have gone entire days (hour are a time usage)  using it and not had to charge it till I got home or went to bed. One issue that still remains is the onboard WiFi on the console is still just as bad as it was in the first original model.

Turned on the console for the first time and immediately received error code 2002-4153. I called Nintendo Support and I have to send it to their repair service. Didn't even make it to their profile setup. I have to wait 3 weeks now for it to return with the functionality that was expected upon purchase. Very disappointed.

The Wii and Wii u were cool consoles, but i really only used them to play like mario, or gamecube games on, they were never really used to play "wii games". well the switch completely turns my opinion of nintendo consoles around. I have a gameboy advance, and still play the old pokemon games on it from time to time, but the switch is so much more than that. Its like combining all of the good things about a wii, a gameboy advance, and even an old n64, and packing it all into one box, that can even be taken on the go.I am super excited to own one, and i cant wait for more switch games to come out, BOTW, lets go eevee, Smash, the upcoming pokemon sword, and mario odyssey are my definite favorites.
I got two of these for a couple reasons:1. I wanted to upgrade my niece from her Nintendo DS.

My launch day Nintendo bricked and is on the eternal repair list at Nintendo due to Covid.  I got really lucky to get another here at retail.  This is the new improved red box V2 one.  Much better battery life and stabilizer.  I have noticed the differences.  If you love Nintendo, get it, much better than the Lite. You can play on TV or hand held.  This Grandma who has been playing since the original Nintendo, plays on a 64 inch 4K Samsung and it looks fine.
-was advertised as new was actually a used product-was dirty when I pulled it out of the box, hair and smudges covered it when I pulled it out of the box

I was so lucky!!! I happened to randomly check one morning after I had already given up on my search for a switch at retail price and THEY WERE IN STOCK FOR 299!! (sold by amazon) I nearly cried of happiness and immediately bought it. It took a week and a couple days to get here, there was a delay in my delivery. I was worried they had sold me a sold out switch but nope it came in! Just hold on and be patient and don’t buy from these greedy scalpers.A few things about the system itself:

The only time I’ve used a Switch has been playing on one that my friends own. Just these experiences has really intrigued me into getting my very own Switch. I love playing video games and I own an Xbox and PS4, so I figure at some point it was time to complete the trifecta. While I’m more of an Xbox person, I will say I am very impressed by the Switch. It is a very simple console, but genius in of itself. I’ve had some Nintendo gaming devices here and there. A SNES back in the day, but mostly their portable ones from the Gameboy to the Advanced to the DS and 3DS. The Switch combines that of a home console and a portable gaming device and for that I love it. I can put it in the dock and play it on my TV. I can play it handheld which will be great for road trips or maybe just wanting to play anywhere. This was a brilliant move by Nintendo and it makes the Switch really stand on its own.Now what I’d say my favorite thing about the console is it’s simplicity. This device is made for one thing only and that is for playing video games. The console is both modern and old school at the same time. Would definitely recommend to anyone who really likes Nintendo and their games.

The switch is a very nice system, read the reviews of wobbly joy con’s which there are many of but figured what are the chances I get one with that issue, Ordered it as a christmas gift, arrived on time the week before, christmas day, present gets opened and of course the joy con is wobbling, not enough to come loose but enough that it would definitely preoccupy while you play. Not for nothing but nintendo is getting to dollar, offering the worst deals on the switch and with the switch being it’s big hit , still can’t have quality control, the switch should feel as solid as a tank, not cheap when the joy con wiggles right out if the box and nintendos policy for fixing their mistake in my particular right out if the box defect is that they might send you a replacement which might be the plain grey/black instead if the colored joy con that I paid for is imo,a disgusting business practice, way to stand by their flagship product and instantly  turned me into a never by another nintendo product for anyone person. Listen, its a nice system but the quality is lacking and their support even for their mistake is insulting, so buyer beware, you’re playing quality roulette.

It's pretty pathetic that in the 2.5 years since the launch of the Nintendo switch, all Nintendo has done is take away the "Switch" functionality with the Switch Lite, and improve the battery on the actual Switch.Not to mention all the features lacking from the software that should have been implemented before the launch of the switch.

This is a great deal but it doesn't tell you anywhere in the post that it doesn't come in original packaging. It even shows it in the Nintendo box. I had to seek and buy an original empty box off eBay Because my son knows about GameStop and believes in Santa still. I didn't want any doubt put in his head. A heads up anywhere in the post would've been nice is all I'm saying. Still a good deal but plan on adding $20+ and buying a box from eBay if you want it in the box as shown.

Just received it today( one day earlier then was told so that's a plus) took it out and plugged it in. My 8yr old daughter hasn't put it down since. And for all the people wondering and asking it is the newer model with the longer battery life, yes it is the one with the longer battery life so buy it now because no ones selling the new ones just very few and they’re going fast

I know this isn't an Amazon product but I can't start this review without mentioning the awesome job this company does in keeping its customers... <-- which for some reason some other organizations have forgotten, anyways.  I first purchased the Nintendo Switch about 2.5 years ago.  recently, there was a problem with the Switch and it stopped turning on.  I called Amazon, at which time they let me know that I surpasses my warranty on the item.  I immediately was disappointed and than immediately relieved for the next thing the Amazon representative told me was that I was going to be able to receive a $340 refund of the 399 i spent on the item.  After 30 months, if you tell me that I would receive almost a full refund after my warranty had run out... I am still in shock.Now as for the Switch itself... We love it.  It's not a Playstation 4 or Xbo 10000 or something.  But it's a great family system that also is great for when friends and relatives visit.  Recommend the Switch for every household.

Good console if you can get it for MSRP, it took me weeks of trying to buy before I was able to get through the checkout process with all the scalpers buying them up within minutes.  Don't pay over MSRP, the shortage is temporary.

When I first received the switch I was so excited. Everything was in the box and it looked brand new.  At first I didn’t have enough to buy any physical games so I bought some games for sale on the E shop. And it worked great! But only till after the return date passed did I realize, the game card reader was broken! When I first played one of the games it seemed to work fine. But later when I removed the game and I inserted it again, it told me it couldn’t read the game card. Easy enough, just restarting the switch made it read. But now months have past and the only game card it seems to read is animal crossing. All my other games just wont read. Even a brand new copy of Minecraft. Since I believe I still have warranty, I wanted to contact Nintendo for repairs but it’s been shut down due to COVID. I hope I can get this fix. I’m very disappointed.
DO bot buy!
This form of scalping should not be allowed during a pandemic.
We revived an empty box. So disappointing....

the joy cons were having tons of problems 2 weeks after purchasing. this product has zero durability regardless of how careful you are. The games are almost all overpriced and i regret buying. especially since I was so excited to get it

Playing switch games is great, i bought 5 games with my system for variety. Turns out the most amazing feature i was not aware of before i started playing. The online subscription they offer for a measly 20 bucks a year offers a library of nes and snes games you can play at will. You can save state in them as well up to 4 save files for each game. You can ALSO reverse time when playing (it is a cheap feature but VERY cool still) Died in mario, just hold in two buttons, reverse the game like a dvr on tv show and bam, try that part again right where you just were!! i do not know if it is true but i read they have two more slots for future classic systems in their coding in the system. We have Nintendo 8bit, Super Nintendo but we could see Nintendo 64 or game cube in the future as well.All 5 games i picked up for it run great as well, no complaints except it was 150 dollars more than list price. Alas these are the times we live in.
Muy bueno diversión

First 3 weeks great product until everytime I go to play a game it makes a loud sound so loud I can’t even play... really disappointed because I paid a lot for this console. I messaged seller and hopefully I get an answer back.
inconforme un desastre no se lo recomiendo a nadie
The console is great, just dont but it from amazon cuz their shipment is the worst

We place an order on 8/8 and receive it on 8/15 during the weekend. We purchase a Mario party and start to play today on 8/17. But we find out the Nintendo Switch Dock can't work, even the green-light of the Dock doesn't show up. (Nintendo Switch itself is working well.)We're not sure if it's a AC Adapter issue or Nintendo Switch Dock issue.  Just send an email to Nintendo Switch website for request support and wish we can get the adapter & dock replacement. Otherwise, we should just buy the Nintendo Switch Lite for saving money.

With all of our lives being changed and us being shut down I needed something to help pass the time. The nintendo switch has been great for me. Most nights of quarantine are spent playing mario kart with friends.While the pandemic is a very scary situation my Nintendo Switch has helped me to forgot about all the things happening just for a few hours each day and return to normalcy. This is great for everyone - family and friends of all ages.
Onr of the controllers came in damaged.  My kids could not wait for repairs, so I reordered a new set of joy con controllers.  Should have been given to me instead.

I love my Nintendo switch. Even though it was overpriced, I understand that it is due to low supply due to the pandemic so I am not that upset about it as the console has been working perfectly and came with everything advertised. The only problems I ran into were low memory and short battery life on the device but those were easily fixed. The seller was also very helpful and the switch arrived much earlier than expected and on my birthday, coincidentally. Definitely worth its original price ($299) and even though the rise in price is disappointing and definitely pricey, I would argue that its also somewhat worth it. Playing on this is a good way to spend lockdown, so I don't regret making this purchase.
A versatile gaming system that is both fun for the family and for the individual.WHAT I LIKE:

I sold off my old Nintendo Switch, and picked this up at a discount. I tried to sell to gamestop, but they're not very clear on if they give you the full $250 they where advertising. So I opted to sell it online. The great thing about the new version is the significantly longer battery life. It's quite impressive. Here's to hoping they come out with a Switch Pro version with bigger/better screen :)

Im enjoying it so farMy problem is that the box came damaged, and all the bags insite were loosely open, im not sure if thats just how it ships, or yet i was shipped another “new” item that was most certainly used. my concern being that there were NO stickers holding the box closed

The Joycons are painted. Nintendo officially stated not to clean them with alcohol, and I've heard of the paint rubbing off for some users. It's pretty ridiculous that they're so fragile.The rest of the console looks great though! The dock itself is beautiful; It is molded in that wonderful cream colored plastic, and so are the Joycon straps! It's just such a shame that they cheaped out with the Joycons.
Received the item on time but the box was opened. It looked like the switch was already used

I love this switch really it’s beautiful and I’m more than excited to play on it and play during this quarantine. The only thing I don’t like is that it’s overpriced. I shouldn’t have had to pay double or more for this switch but I did. And luckily I had enough but others may not and it makes me feel bad. It would’ve been nice to pay the original price or at least make it more of an affordable price. Or not just bought it and sell it for more and let others have the actual chance of getting one in stores or online when it came out. If you have the money for this and if you’re a big fan of animal crossing I would say that this is something to do but I wish this was for affordable for others who may be fans of animal crossing as well and don’t have this much money to spare.
it works but was supposed to be new but came with a account already on it and perental lock already on it so couldnt play one of my games until we called nintendo and they had to help us unlock it
Me and my family have only just received it and it is awesome.So far, the battery does seem to be lasting a bit longer and for the casual gamer, like me, I'm enjoying it.

The Switch is the console to have. We were very lucky to get one during the worst of the pandemic when they were sold out everywhere. Amazon really came through! Our 8-year old has loved playing Animal Crossing while stuck at home - 12 weeks so far! It's going to be a quiet stay-at-home summer, so I'm glad we have this as a distraction.We also have a Wii U which in many ways is the first generation of the Switch. A lot of ideas that Nintendo tried out on the Wii U went on to be implemented even better on the Switch - such as the handheld game pad. And the games! Mario Kart 8? First on Wii U. Breath of the Wild - Zelda? Also on Wii U. We love our Wii U and love the Switch even more!

This was a gift for our son "from Santa" and he was sooo thrilled. Until 5 days later right joy-con died (neon red). The console does not see it as attached and none of the buttons on the joy-con are responding. We tried all the on-line help steps available to no avail. Will try to send it to Nintendo for repair, but I am absolutely unhappy about this. And you can imagine how my 7 year old son feels...

This is my first game console. I like how it is small and light for easy carrying around. But the games are really expensive, like a Mario party game is $59. I think they probably do not make much money from the console but they make a lot of money by selling the games. You can easily pay more for the games than the console itself. I also bought this for my little kid but it turned out that there is barely games for little ones.

Factory, but the $30 reward/rebate was obviously a scamazon issue. Shoulda bought it at target, a retailer at least will qualify the $30 rebate. And acknowledge it actually existed.  Class action anyone?

compre la switch por Amazon.com Services LLC y al momento de conectar al televisor no funciona y al reclamar la garantia me indican que no pueden hacer nada. Tenia fe de que al comprar por aca tendria mejor soporte y aseguraba una compra de calidad pero no, viendo que ahora me toca quedarme con un nintendo defectuoso hubiera preferido pagar casi el doble en alguna tienda de electrodomesticos donde si aplicaria la garantia sin ningun problema. Lastima que siendo una pagina tan buena para compras no ayuden con la garantia ni te den soluciones al equipo defectuoso.

Honestly, I'm glad I have a switch but didn't realize the new switch was still only getting sold for the same amount as $300. I honestly didn't know I was getting ripped off until everyone told me I was. While the design and colors are super cute I'm really sad they jacked the price up and I had no idea.

I travel often for work, so needed something to do in hotels and long flights. The Switch hits the mark. This newer version has great battery life, i never had the old one with the shorter life, but no complaints on this one.I immediately jumped in with the old NES and SNES games you can get by subscribing to the online platform. They look great and play great. Also have been playing Link's Awakening and Super Mario Odyssey, beautiful games and looking forward to more.

Fantastic Console! Nintendo truly knows how to design a solid gaming console from the portability of the Switch and being able to play it on the TV. What I love about the Switch is the games are actually full length instead of the shorter and more casual games on the 3DS.  The games are expensive but the PS4 and Xbox were too when they first came out. The Switch is still a fairly new console and a lot of great ports are coming to it.  I always look out for deals and end up with games for $40. Overall I truly am enjoying the Switch being an owner of a PS4 Pro and Xbox One S.

This was my first hand held gaming device and I think it is a very unique, innovating what a portable console should be. I love the portability of it on the go and the ability to allow multiple players play at once. For $300 I think this is a solid gaming console that can be used to pour hundreds of hours into and still find games refreshing. The Nintendo game lineup also has the best exclusives out of the other competitors, from Mario to Zelda to Animal Crossing, there’s a game that suits anyone’s taste. Of course there are improvements to be made such as the joycons being small and sometimes uncomfortable in the even if you put it in together like a controller, it still doesn’t replace the feeling of a real full sized controller. In the future, I would just like Nintendo to make the portable screen 1080p with a 120hz refresh rate for an even better gaming experience. But overall, with its creativity and innovation still standing strong 3 years later, there isn’t much you can’t love about the Nintendo Switch.

Love the thing, being able to play a lot of these games at home or out and about is definitely a winning situation. I can't compare the battery life to the previous Switch but I haven't had a chance to kill it yet so great job Nintendo.

First things first I got my Switch from Mums Collectibles & Stuff so this will mostly be a review of them as I've already owned a Switch and knew what to expect from the system.What most people don't realize is that consoles are in high demand this year (2020) and we all know the reason so I can't fault a company for increasing the price on item due to high demand and low stock of said item. That being said Mums Collectibles & Stuff is by far the cheapest I have seen a new switch go for on amazon, ebay or a number of other websites.
Portátil, Buena consola, nueva y perfectas condiciones pero los juegos en la tienda digital, esta muy caros. Además no puedes prestar tu cuenta y que jueguen con la cuenta del titular.
It's as amazing as the hype makes it. But don't go overpaying $600 for it. Wait til it's back in stock $299.

Honestly as much as my wife loves this thing its not worth it. Ours came with the game code and it doesn't work and the seller won't work with you even after showing the proof. The code does not work. Yes it says game doesn't come with but the one they sent does....that tells me they bought in bulk without knowing what they bought then maked it up...karma is a b****.

Item was in perfect condition when arrived.  Shipped faster then expected.  Four stars do to no manual, rather easy set up even without documents.  I feel I was one of the last buyers at below three hundred dollars.  This is the updated unit with extended battery life.  No visuable damage at all.  Unit runs perfectly, shipping box arrived undamaged, everything package neatly.  Unit appeared to be brand new.  Just decided to give this five stars, I honestly have no issues with item or seller.  Would buy again from seller.

I really wanted to be able to play video games while I was at work. I am a doctor and some nights just are slow since I work ER/Overnight. This was the easiest route for me to have the ability to game. Only issue I would say is the fact you need a capture card if you want to share with your friends via discord. Other than that, its easy to set up with TV/Just use with joycons. Accessories are expensive and so are games so I suggest figuring out exactly what you want and looking for sales etc. Also google how to make sure you are getting the new model since they are selling the old model with the same name. Theres a few things you can do to ensure you are getting the newest!
Love the switch. Ultimate for the gaming dad. Game anywhere anytime.

I LOVE IT.  It is exactly the same as any other switch but because I love animal crossing I had to get this one.  Everything works,  and I'm happy I found this special edition still in stock. A must for any animal crossing fan!  I do wish it would have come with a copy of the game. But I'm happy I bought either way!

I now have two of these consoles and, if needed, would buy a third. I love my switch so much. It is by far my favorite console. The ease of switching it from the handheld to the tv is flawless. The battery life on the new consoles is much better than the previous model which is great. I gave my old model to my three-year-old who loves playing this console as much as I do! Every morning, the first thing he says when he wakes up is "Can I play my game?" So it really is a great console for all ages! Would buy again and again!!
I got everything except the real console

I don’t know about you but I battled with getting the Switch for ages. I wasn’t too sure if the price of the device was worth it or not but I eventually bit the bullet and bought it and I have no regrets.I like how the device can be hooked up to your tv or you can bring it with you on the go. Right now as I get settled in a new place I’ve been bringing it with me on the go, sometimes I’m on campus and there’s nothing to do or I’m waiting in between classes so I just whip out my Switch and begin to play.

I'm quite pleased with my brand new Switch! I specifically got it because I am a fan of Animal Crossing and was happy I got to snag one on Amazon before they sold out. It works like a normal Switch and I actually sold my old one just to get this beauty. ^_^This Switch is a SPECIAL EDITION and I hope they release more for the people that actually want it! PLEASE AVOID RESELLERS!!!

Many things could be said about this device but, there's so many things that make up for it.Seamless connectivity with mostly everything. Joy-cons(controllers) connect right away once attached through wireless electrical conduction like a power mat.

If you’re willing to wait, Amazon occasionally gets some, and puts them up at regular price.  Received mine much sooner than their initial estimate. As for the console... it’s fun, everyone knows that. Great first-party games, and a nice selection of third-party games. Okay battery, unusual but feature-packed controllers, and a tiny bit uncomfortable for extended play in handheld mode. Less powerful than its competitors, but ray tracing does not a good game make.Just do everyone a favor and don’t pay a scalper for the console. That’s the only way to choke them out. Stay patient and check multiple stores, regularly. Eventually you’ll find one at the proper price. You’ll have your dignity, do a service for the community, and definitely get your money’s worth!

I already own a Switch but wanted to pick one up for my fiancee to have fun during quarantine. She is someone who has never played video games and didn't like them on the few occasions I tried to play a multiplayer game with her. Managed to pick up a used one (that looked virtually new) from Amazon Warehouse for about $240, which was a steal. She is really enjoying it and slowly becoming a regular gamer (1-2 hours a day), and the Switch has several games that are great for newcomers. She prefers handheld mode while I almost exclusively play it on my TV, so having that option is awesome.

A Nintendo Switch with extended battery life? What's not to love? It's a no-brainer! Nintendo is always at the forefront of console innovation and they didn't miss a beat with the Switch. Want to play a game on your tv like a traditional console? Drop the Switch into the dock and game on in 1080p HD. Need to hit the road? Slide the Switch out of the dock and continue your gaming on the go in brilliant 720p HD. And I haven't even gotten into the built-in option for multiplayer gaming with the removable controllers. Like I said, cutting edge console innovation from Nintendo! Come for the innovative console, stay for the myriad of both cutting edge and nostalgia-inducing first party titles from Nintendo. Not into Mario and Link games? How about the largest library of quality Indie games and old-school games? No matter how you look at it, the Switch is where it's at!
Don't buy from resellers :/ price is ridiculous

The Nintendo Switch was bought for my son for his 12th birthday. So far its been about 2 weeks give or take and he still loves it. It works well, no issues with the delivery, packaging or the product.He loves playing on it during free times from school, homework and after school activities.
The build quility is good. The are some good titles.But mostly eshop is full of trash indie titles for unreasonable $15

Had since February, lightly used but now my left joy con won't charge tried the troubleshooting steps on their official website still nothing i also have a standalone charging base for my joycons and it won't charge either, seeing online this is a common issue. Opened a repair request ticket with Nintendo which advised me to wait until they contact me to ship it to them and once they get it, may several weeks to fix it, bummer I had just got animal crossing too and I  can't play it with one joy con and I refuse to buy another one for 80 dollars. Didn't realize how poor quality Nintendo has become I'll be sending animal crossing back and hope since it's no point in having it now.

I absolutely adore the Switch and Nintendo as a whole, I’ve had a dry spell with them recently and buying a Switch changed that.Anyways, as many of you already know, the damper on production ability and rise in demand have seriously affected the availability of this product. BUT you can still get them new, at MSRP, like I did!

Its a good system but wow it cost a lot. but the games have reduced a bit so that helps. Regardless there was a little boy who nver stopped asking for one lol. Its gonna be fun to watch him open it up.

I ordered the Nintendo Switch for MSRP and I thought it was too good to be true, but I ordered it Thursday and it came Monday! The website I used to help me find stock was stockinformer.com. It alerts you the minute there's Switch stock and you just have to be quick enough to buy it. It may take a few times and a few clicks but I was eventually able to purchase mine and I love this thing! It's really helped me curb boredom. I hope this helps anyone and please don't buy a Switch from any of these 3rd parties jacking up the price.

I've been wanting a switch for a long time, and finally managed to get my hands on one close to MSRP (at $307) during the pandemic. I only have one game on it so far, but to say I'm pleased and impressed so far is a bit of an understatement. It's nice to be able to play on my TV in the living room, and when someone else wants to play their own game or watch Netflix, I can just take the switch out of the dock and play in handheld mode, but stay in the same room and socialize. I like being able to bring the game into my room and not be forced to play it in the living room if I don't want to deal with all the noise.It's pleasant to hold, with just a bit of weight to it to feel sturdy. The Joycons are nice to the touch, although the sticks are a little too 'smooth' for my liking so I put some grips on. I haven't experienced any drift, yet, but it's only been a few days. They're very satisfying to hold, and even more satisfying to click into place on either the tablet or the included joy-con grip. I haven't tried the straps yet.

One of the joycons is a little weird but like, wow!! My little animal crossing machine is working really good to let me keep my mind off this whole quarantine thing!! I've had it for a few weeks now and my friends were wondering if I died.Not many downsides, There's lots of games to play on here since the switch has been out for a while and it doesn't even have to be connected to a tv to let you play. If you know a kid who loves video games but you don't want your 9 year old to get shouted at for being bad at video games by 20-somethings that want to win games after work, this little guy doesn't have voice chat so you don't need to worry.

I kept checking and FINALLY was able to find a Switch for retail. Thank you Amazon!  We have a couple games so far.  Animal Crossing New Horizons, super smash bros, and Mario Kart 8.  I love how Nintendo is more parent friendly games, you don't have to worry about the games your kids are playing on Nintendo Switch so much compared to say games on other consoles with adult ratings and such.. Love that most 2 player games can be played with one joy con, (although a second joycon is on our to buy list)  the reason being is adult hands holding half a joycon is kind of hard.  If you can grab one at retail and are in the market, i'd say go ahead and pull the trigger.  If you can't find at retail, i'd suggest just waiting it out until you can. :)

The switch is honestly the perfect console. Being able to easily transition from a portable console on the go to a docked console connected to your TV is everything I wanted. When I am tired and no longer want to sit at the TV and play, I grab it and jump in bed and just continue. My only issue is quite technical: the resistance of the Joycon controller buttons is too high. Takes too much effort to press them down. I got a pro controller and the difference is astounding. I don't understand why the Joycons don't have "soft" buttons like the pro controller does.

So I rarely leave reviews but this needed a review, I buy over 40 switches a month for my business, and this the first time I opened the shipping box and I was taking the box out before opening I heard some noise and box seemed light... I know how heavy they usually are and never have I heard some noice upon holding the box. I opened the box and this is literally what I see... looks like a horrible mistake and I’ve read other reviews SAME ISSUE SHIPPED AND SOLD BY AMAZONat least they helped me out but still horrible

By far my and my family's favorite gaming system ever! Believe me we've had so many gaming consoles over the years. My 8 year old girl will not put this down! She loves Zelda! We plah Just Dance frequently and it has excellent intelligence to what you are doing. It really gets you moving if you are willing! You can play classic with it hooked up in a dock and connected to the TV (console is very small which is great), or you can put the joy cons on the console and play, of you can play with it looking like a old Nintendo 64 controller or x box/playstation controller. It's also touch screen!

The switch is a great game system but my blue joy-con broke within a couple days of playing with it. It was very disappointing as I bought it for my son’s birthday so I waited about a month before giving it to him. Of course, that meant I could not return it once the controller broke. We had planned a big road trip and I was hoping the switch would keep him entertained but because of the broken controller, it was useless the whole time. Nintendo has a warranty on it, but being holiday season I haven’t gone through their “process” of returning it and getting a new one. All I can say is its been a very disappointing experience with this Nintendo product delivered by Amazon. Just sucks something so expensive can break so easy.

When I was little I used to be able to spend all day playing games. Of course as I got older, my amount of free time decreased exponentially.
